page.title: 19"ORCADIAN" NEWSPAPER: DOUNBY
page.content: {TWINS A set of twins were born on Christmas Day at the Balfour Hospital. They had to be flown to Aberdeen after birth. The twins have now returned from the Special Nursery and are doing well at home. {HEALTH BOARD PROTEST The Health Board has protested against the planned dumping of nuclear waste at the Stormy Bank. The chairman Mr. Robertson said it was not a good idea to dump it there. He said the Board should be against the project. {LIFEBOAT FUND The garden at Kierfold House, Sandwick will be open on the 16th June in aid of the RNLI. There will be a sales table and a raffle, then there will be a meal for everyone. The Occidental Pipe Band will be playing.
